intro: Verticordia chrysantha, commonly known as the golden wattle or golden verticordia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences.
